recipe.title: Black SesameBrown Sugar Shortbread
ingredients: 1 cup (2 sticks) unsalted butter, room temperature
2 tbsp plus 2 tsp black sesame seeds
instructions: Preheat oven to 325° with racks in center and upper third. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Whisk together flour, cornstarch, salt, and sesame seeds. Add flour mixture to butter mixture, 1 cup at a time, beating after each addition until incorporated. Transfer mixture to a surface and knead into a smooth dough. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Transfer chilled dough to a lightly floured surface; roll into a 1/2"-thick rectangle. Cut into 2" squares, then cut each square into triangles. Transfer to prepared baking sheets. Bake until edges are light golden brown, 20-22 minutes. Let cool.
Preheat oven to 325° with racks in center and upper third. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper.
Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy.

Whisk together flour, cornstarch, salt, and sesame seeds. Add flour mixture to butter mixture, 1 cup at a time, beating after each addition until incorporated. Transfer mixture to a surface and knead into a smooth dough. Wrap in plastic and refrigerate for 20 minutes.
Transfer chilled dough to a lightly floured surface; roll into a 1/2"-thick rectangle. Cut into 2" squares, then cut each square into triangles. Transfer to prepared baking sheets.
Bake until edges are light golden brown, 20-22 minutes. Let cool.
